result.execSummary:
The defendant Everett J Hembrook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on case 22CF1263.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight time. Sentence credit of 118 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Cases 22CM1175, 22CM1182 and 22CF1263.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:33 PM Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.


The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
6 Months Jail - Straight time (Credit for 118 days).  CONCURRENT with 22CF1263

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF1263.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have received a global offer and request a plea and sentenicing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Michael Osborne in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  This case is tagging along with the defendant's felony matter.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request for Substitution against Judge Bugenhagen Jr., received on today's date. Filed by Atty. Andrew Herbers.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 08-09-2022: Denied, the case was already reassigned to Judge Bohren.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
